urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

Via the NEW Diglis fish pass, twaite shad can now swim past #Worcester on their #SevernShadRun for the first time in nearly 180yrs! 🎉🐟🎉 
Please watch & share our video! #FollowTheShad #FishMigration @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @HeritageFundM_E @LIFEprogramme https://t.co/kzh7NFPljc
@EnvAgencyMids Unacceptable.  !!!! https://t.co/X2HcInuw3e
People have to fight not only polluting industries but now also the @EnvAgency and their own government @DefraGovUK to stop the rot. How on earth did that happen? https://t.co/oN4HCpp52u

@reacctionary @JWillson1 @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency You're quite right! Their employers' liability insurer would hit the roof.

Basically the issue is @EnvAgency can’t afford to pay for the finishing if they were to close @RedIndustries2 down, so they expected us to live with landfill gas tell 2026 they need holding accountable @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #AirPollution https://t.co/ym8CKAmjgu

urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
A joint statement from @ChilternsAONB & @BucksCouncil
on the potential damage - beyond the obvious- caused by boring massive holes in a fractured chalk geology. 
The questions raised here need serious address, not spin and rubber stamp approval @EnvAgency
https://t.co/kbOkQgUjAG https://t.co/zKTjm7TByN

tweets.text: @Beeron1030 @PJennings88 @EnvAgency The obligation is to provide evidence that the aquifer isn't under threat, not the other way around. If everything is fine why doesn't HS2 and the EA share their evidence and why has Affinity Water been granted a multimillion indemnity to protect its revenues in case of damage?

@Tus_M_ @scottdegg @StaffordshireCC is everyone in uk walking round dizzy cos the toxic gases they are being subjected to, temporary what's that when the poisons are 24/7, @AaronBell4NUL do you agree, don't wants our kids seriously ill in 30 yrs cos they think temporary as in couple of mins now & then #StopTheStink

Today, with @BucksCouncil, we issued a position statement raising concerns on the impact of HS2's tunnelling & drilling on the chalk aquifer. This issue is of huge public interest & we're now seeking full disclosure & public consultation. 

Read in full: https://t.co/0NiPcvskGN https://t.co/JwJT4Qjt8w

Really proud of this #nfm project that we delivered for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW. We delivered a range of slow the flow, storage and surface flow disruption interventions. The resultant boggy conditions made place better for nature too - winner! #naturalprocesses #propernfm https://t.co/SRe0FC9OFi

tweets.text: @SimmoBurgess @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids And it took 5 days to publish it .
@SimmoBurgess @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids I've just thought did they or did they not receive 1200 impact statements ? @SimonTagg , i'm sure I saw a pic of you sending them .

@EnvAgencyMids The odour has gotten worse since the capping took place. I didn't think it was possible for it to get worse but sadly I was wrong. I'm breathing in H2S while typing this tweet, as the noxious gas has pervaded my home again. More sleep deprivation & stress for many in NUL tonight.
@a_merrydew @EnvAgencyMids Your right it has got worse, and tonight is going to be another sleepless night.

@EnvAgencyMids I’ve just come out of hospital after spending 9 days in there and the stink in my home is unbearable, I’m struggling to breathe and my throat is burning. When are you going to do your job and close the site

@EnvAgencyMids Can't even hide in bed, it's in there, Bathroom it's in there, hallway is unbearable, kitchen it's there, living room it's there. Surprise me and do something, like your job, make our environment safe.
@EnvAgencyMids Why don't you come live in these people's homes, or better still come stay in a hospital bed, then give a more appropriate assessment. Who's getting paid off here ????
